alert.note: Alert for Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Big Horn and south central Yellowstone Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 610 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles north of Fort Smith, or 24 miles southwest of Hardin, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Big Horn and south central Yellowstone Counties. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
